questions.question: I am not the …………………….. bit afraid of dogs.
questions.description: Not the least can mean ‘not at all’.

questions.question: The essay with the ……………………… mistakes isn’t always the best.
questions.description: We use fewest before plural nouns.

questions.question: Last year I ……………………….. to water-ski.
questions.description: Learn can be followed by an infinitive or how + infinitive.

questions.question: I want to ………………………. down for a few minutes.
questions.description: To lie down is to become horizontal.

questions.question: The ………………………. days have been quite hectic.
questions.description: We say the last few days, not the last days.

questions.question: Do you ………………………….. to ride a bicycle?
questions.description: We cannot put a that-clause immediately after know. Instead we write ‘know how to’.

questions.question: The dog wagged ……………………… tail.
questions.description: Its is a possessive word like his or her.

questions.question: He …………………………. out angry words at his tormenters.
questions.description: In American English both spit and spat can be used as past tense and past participle of spit.

questions.question: I understood her ………………………….. her strange accent.
questions.description: Despite is a preposition. We use it before a noun.

questions.question: I have bought some eggs in case she ……………………. to dinner.
questions.description: We normally use a present tense after in case to refer to the future.

questions.question: We ……………………….. Mumbai at 4 am.
questions.description: Arrive can be followed by in or at.

questions.question: We landed ………………………… Mumbai in the morning.
questions.description: Land can be followed by at or in.
